meanings.definition: The act of making a high-pitched sound by forcing air through a small opening.
meanings.sent1: The whisting of the teapot signaled that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent2: I heard the whisting of the wind through the tiny gap in the window.
meanings.sent3: The whisting of the kettle made the cat jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her whisting laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The whisting of the steam engine echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A person who makes a high-pitched sound by forcing air through a small opening.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was known in the neighborhood as the whisting princess.
meanings.sent2: The whisting of the bird catcher could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The whisting at the party came from the talented singer.
meanings.sent4: He was a whisting wizard on the harmonica, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The whisting of the flute player enchanted everyone in the park.
